meanings.definition: Cause (someone) to lose enthusiasm or loyalty.
meanings.sent1: The constant negativity from the boss was disaffecting the employees.
meanings.sent2: The constant rain was disaffecting the picnic attendees.
meanings.sent3: The magician's failed tricks were disaffecting the audience, making them doubt his skills.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds disaffecting the sunny mood of the party.
meanings.sent5: The boring lecture was disaffecting the students, causing them to lose interest.

meanings.sent1: The false promises made by the politician were disaffecting the voters.
meanings.sent2: The discovery of the cheating scandal was disaffecting the students.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's defeat in the movie was disaffecting the young fans, making them question his abilities.
meanings.sent4: The shattered dreams were disaffecting her view of the world.
meanings.sent5: The harsh reality was disaffecting his optimistic outlook on life.
